method.name: IsOpaque
method.comment: Returns true if this AndroidNetUri is opaque like "mailto:nobody@google.com". The scheme-specific part of an opaque AndroidNetUri cannot start with a '/'. Added in API level 1

method.name: GetBooleanQueryParameter
method.comment: Searches the query string for the first value with the given key and interprets it as a boolean value. "false" and "0" are interpreted as false, everything else is interpreted as true. Key: which will be decoded DefaultValue: the default value to return if there is no query parameter for key. Returns the boolean interpretation of the query parameter key. Added in API level 11

method.name: IsAbsolute
method.comment: Returns true if this AndroidNetUri is absolute, i.e. if it contains an explicit scheme. Added in API level 1

method.name: GetQueryParameter
method.comment: Searches the query string for the first value with the given key. Key: which will be encoded Returns the decoded value or null if no parameter is found. Added in API level 1

method.name: NormalizeScheme
method.comment: Return an equivalent AndroidNetUri with a lowercase scheme component. This aligns the AndroidNetUri with Android best practices for intent filtering. For example, "HTTP://www.android.com" becomes "http://www.android.com" All AndroidNetUris received from outside Android (such as user input, or external sources like Bluetooth, NFC, or the Internet) should be normalized before they are used to create an Intent. This method does not validate bad AndroidNetUri's, or 'fix' poorly formatted AndroidNetUri's - so do not use it for input validation. A AndroidNetUri will always be returned, even if the AndroidNetUri is badly formatted to begin with and a scheme component cannot be found. Returns normalized AndroidNetUri (never null). Added in API level 16

method.name: GetQueryParameters
method.comment: Searches the query string for parameter values with the given key. Key: which will be encoded Returns a list of decoded values or empty list. Added in API level 1

method.name: IsHierarchical
method.comment: Returns true if this AndroidNetUri is hierarchical like "http://google.com". Absolute AndroidNetUris are hierarchical if the scheme-specific part starts with a '/'. Relative AndroidNetUris are always hierarchical. Added in API level 1

method.name: BuildUpon
method.comment: Constructs a new builder, copying the attributes from this AndroidNetUri. Added in API level 1

method.name: ToString
method.comment: Returns the encoded string representation of this AndroidNetUri. Example: "http://google.com/" Added in API level 1

method.name: isRelative
method.comment: Returns true if this AndroidNetUri is relative, i.e. if it doesn't contain an explicit scheme. Added in API level 1

property.name: Path
property.comment: Gets the decoded path. Returns the decoded path, or null if this is not a hierarchical AndroidNetUri (like "mailto:nobody@google.com") or the AndroidNetUri is invalid. Added in API level 1

property.name: Scheme
property.comment: Gets the scheme of this AndroidNetUri. Example: "http" Returns the scheme or null if this is a relative AndroidNetUri. Added in API level 1

property.name: Query
property.comment: Gets the decoded query component from this AndroidNetUri. The query comes after the query separator ('?') and before the fragment separator ('#'). This method would return "q=android" for "http://www.google.com/search?q=android". Returns the decoded query or null if there isn't one. Added in API level 1

property.name: Authority
property.comment: Gets the decoded authority part of this AndroidNetUri. For server addresses, the authority is structured as follows: [ userinfo '@' ] host [ ':' port ] Examples: "google.com", "bob@google.com:80" Returns the authority for this AndroidNetUri or null if not present. Added in API level 1

property.name: EncodedUserInfo
property.comment: Gets the encoded user information from the authority. For example, if the authority is "nobody@google.com", this method will return "nobody". Returns the user info for this AndroidNetUri or null if not present. Added in API level 1

property.name: Port
property.comment: Gets the port from the authority for this AndroidNetUri. For example, if the authority is "google.com:80", this method will return 80. Returns the port for this AndroidNetUri or -1 if invalid or not present. Added in API level 1

property.name: EncodedPath
property.comment: Gets the encoded path. Returns the encoded path, or null if this is not a hierarchical AndroidNetUri (like "mailto:nobody@google.com") or the AndroidNetUri is invalid. Added in API level 1

property.name: Host
property.comment: Gets the encoded host from the authority for this AndroidNetUri. For example, if the authority is "bob@google.com", this method will return "google.com". Returns the host for this AndroidNetUri or null if not present. Added in API level 1

property.name: UserInfo
property.comment: Gets the decoded user information from the authority. For example, if the authority is "nobody@google.com", this method will return "nobody". Returns the user info for this AndroidNetUri or null if not present. Added in API level 1

property.name: PathSegments
property.comment: Gets the decoded path segments. Returns decoded path segments, each without a leading or trailing '/' or empty list. Added in API level 1

property.name: Fragment
property.comment: Gets the decoded fragment part of this AndroidNetUri, everything after the '#'. Returns the decoded fragment or null if there isn't one. Added in API level 1

property.name: EncodedQuery
property.comment: Gets the encoded query component from this AndroidNetUri. The query comes after the query separator ('?') and before the fragment separator ('#'). This method would return "q=android" for "http://www.google.com/search?q=android". Returns the encoded query or null if there isn't one. Added in API level 1

property.name: SchemeSpecificPart
property.comment: Gets the scheme-specific part of this AndroidNetUri, i.e. everything between the scheme separator ':' and the fragment separator '#'. If this is a relative AndroidNetUri, this method returns the entire AndroidNetUri. Decodes escaped octets. Example: "//www.google.com/search?q=android" Returns the decoded scheme-specific-part. Added in API level 1

property.name: EncodedFragment
property.comment: Gets the encoded fragment part of this AndroidNetUri, everything after the '#'. Returns the encoded fragment or null if there isn't one. Added in API level 1

property.name: LastPathSegment
property.comment: Gets the decoded last segment in the path. Returns the decoded last segment or null if the path is empty. Added in API level 1

property.name: EncodedAuthority
property.comment: Gets the encoded authority part of this AndroidNetUri. For server addresses, the authority is structured as follows: [ userinfo '@' ] host [ ':' port ]. Examples: "google.com", "bob@google.com:80" Returns the authority for this AndroidNetUri or null if not present. Added in API level 1

property.name: QueryParameterNames
property.comment: Returns a set of the unique names of all query parameters. Iterating over the set will return the names in order of their first occurrence. Returns a list of decoded names or empty list. Added in API level 11

property.name: EncodedSchemeSpecificPart
property.comment: Gets the scheme-specific part of this AndroidNetUri, i.e. everything between the scheme separator ':' and the fragment separator '#'. If this is a relative AndroidNetUri, this method returns the entire AndroidNetUri. Leaves escaped octets intact. Example: "//www.google.com/search?q=android" Returns the encoded scheme-specific-part. Added in API level 1

method.name: FromFile2
method.comment: Creates a AndroidNetUri from a file. The AndroidNetUri has the form "file://". Encodes path characters with the exception of '/'. Example: "file:///tmp/android.txt" FilePathAndName: string which contain file path and file name. Returns a AndroidNetUri for the given file Added in API level 1

method.name: FromFile
method.comment: Creates a AndroidNetUri from a file. The AndroidNetUri has the form "file://". Encodes path characters with the exception of '/'. Example: "file:///tmp/android.txt" FilePath: path of file. FileName: with extension. Returns a AndroidNetUri for the given file Added in API level 1

method.name: WithAppendedPath
method.comment: Creates a new AndroidNetUri by appending an already-encoded path segment to a base AndroidNetUri. BaseUri: AndroidNetUri to append path segment to. PathSegment: encoded path segment to append. Returns a new AndroidNetUri based on BaseUri with the given segment appended to the path. Added in API level 1

method.name: FromParts
method.comment: Creates an opaque AndroidNetUri from the given components. Encodes the Ssp which means this method cannot be used to create hierarchical AndroidNetUris. Scheme: of the AndroidNetUri. Ssp: scheme-specific-part, everything between the scheme separator (':') and the fragment separator ('#'), which will get encoded. Fragment: fragment, everything after the '#', null if undefined, will get encoded. Returns AndroidNetUri composed of the given Scheme, Ssp, and Fragment. Added in API level 1

method.name: Encode2
method.comment: Encodes characters in the given string as '%'-escaped octets using the UTF-8 scheme. Leaves letters ("A-Z", "a-z"), numbers ("0-9"), and unreserved characters ("_-!.~'()*") intact. Encodes all other characters with the exception of those specified in the allow argument. S: string to encode. Allow: set of additional characters to allow in the encoded form, null if no characters should be skipped. Returns an encoded version of S suitable for use as a AndroidNetUri component, or null if s is null. Added in API level 1

method.name: Parse
method.comment: Creates a AndroidNetUri which parses the given encoded AndroidNetUri string. UriString: an RFC 2396-compliant, encoded AndroidNetUri. Returns AndroidNetUri for this given UriString. Added in API level 1

method.name: Decode
method.comment: Decodes '%'-escaped octets in the given string using the UTF-8 scheme. Replaces invalid octets with the unicode replacement character ("\\uFFFD"). S: encoded string to decode. Returns the given string with escaped octets decoded, or null if s is null. Added in API level 1

method.name: Encode
method.comment: Encodes characters in the given string as '%'-escaped octets using the UTF-8 scheme. Leaves letters ("A-Z", "a-z"), numbers ("0-9"), and unreserved characters ("_-!.~'()*") intact. Encodes all other characters. S: string to encode. Returns an encoded version of s suitable for use as a AndroidNetUri component, or null if s is null. Added in API level 1

method.name: Scheme
method.comment: Sets the scheme. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: ClearQuery
method.comment: Clears the the previously set query. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: Query
method.comment: Encodes and sets the query. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: Authority
method.comment: Encodes and sets the authority. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: EncodedPath
method.comment: Sets the previously encoded path. If the path is not null and doesn't start with a '/', and if you specify a scheme and/or authority, the builder will prepend the given path with a '/'. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes a new Builder. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: Fragment
method.comment: Encodes and sets the fragment. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: Build
method.comment: Constructs a AndroidNetUri with the current attributes.

method.name: EncodedAuthority
method.comment: Sets the previously encoded authority. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: AppendQueryParameter
method.comment: Encodes the key and value and then appends the parameter to the query string. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: Path
method.comment: Sets the path. Leaves '/' characters intact but encodes others as necessary. If the path is not null and doesn't start with a '/', and if you specify a scheme and/or authority, the builder will prepend the given path with a '/'. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: AppendEncodedPath
method.comment: Appends the given segment to the path. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: EncodedQuery
method.comment: Sets the previously encoded query. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: AppendPath
method.comment: Encodes the given segment and appends it to the path. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: EncodedFragment
method.comment: Sets the previously encoded fragment. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: EncodedOpaquePart
method.comment: Sets the previously encoded opaque scheme-specific-part. Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: OpaquePart
method.comment: Encodes and sets the given opaque scheme-specific-part. OpaquePart: decoded opaque part Returns the same AndroidNetUriBuilder object, for chaining multiple calls into a single statement.

method.name: ToString
method.comment: Returns a string representation of the object.

method.name: AppendId
method.comment: Appends the given ID to the end of the path. ContentUri: to append the ID to. This value cannot be null. Id: to append Returns the given AndroidNetUri. This value cannot be null. Added in API level 1

method.name: WithAppendedId
method.comment: Appends the given ID to the end of the path. ContentUri: to start with. This value cannot be null. Id: to append. Returns a new AndroidNetUri with the given ID appended to the end of the path. This value cannot be null. Added in API level 1

method.name: RemoveId
method.comment: Removes any ID from the end of the path. ContentUri: that ends with an ID. This value cannot be null. Returns a new AndroidNetUri with the ID removed from the end of the path This value cannot be null. Added in API level 29

method.name: ParseId
method.comment: Converts the last path segment to a long. This supports a common convention for content AndroidNetUris where an ID is stored in the last segment. ContentUri: this value cannot be null. Returns the long conversion of the last segment or -1 if the path is empty. Added in API level 1
